subject: Photography
title: The First Digital Camera
description: A fast breakdown of The First Digital Camera for builders.

hook.text: In 1975, a Kodak engineer built a camera that saved images to a cassette tape. It weighed eight pounds.

buildup.text: Steven Sasson's prototype captured a 0.01-megapixel black-and-white image. It took 23 seconds to record.

discovery.text: Kodak's management saw the invention â€” and buried it. They feared it would destroy their film business.

twist.text: Decades later, digital photography did exactly that. Kodak filed for bankruptcy in 2012.

climax.text: The company that invented digital photography was destroyed by it. Innovation without adaptation is suicide.

punchline.text: Kodak invented the future and refused to live in it.

quiz.question: Why did Kodak suppress its own digital camera invention?
options: They feared it would destroy their profitable film business
They couldn't afford to develop it
